text.summary: The full interview–the first time cameras have been brought inside Google's New York offices–airs tonight at 7 p.m. In an exclusive interview with Eric Schmidt, the Google chairman describes the "madness" of an America that attracts the world's smartest innovators, provides them with the best educations, and then "kick them out to found great companies elsewhere...this is madness." ET on CNN's Erin Burnett OutFront.
